intro: Talipariti sepikense, commonly known as the Sepik talipariti, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, palmate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
